1.q_string: The average relative atomic mass of chlorine is \(35.45\). It consists of two naturally occurring isotopes chlorine-35 and chlorine-37. What is the fractional abundance of chlorine-37?
The mass of \(5.6 dm ^{3}\) of a certain gas at STP is \(12.0 g\). Calculate the relative molecular mass of the gas?

<font face="Arial" size="2">What volume of hydrogen gas at 273 K and 1 atm pressure will be consumed in obtaining 21.6 g of elemental boron (atomic mass = 10.8) from the reduction of boron trichloride by hydrogen?</font>
What is the normality of \(0.2 M H _{3} PO _{3}\) solution?
A quantity of \(1.0 g\) of an acid when completely acted upon by magnesium gave \(1.301 g\) of the anhydrous magnesium salt. The equivalent weight of the acid is:
What will be the change in volume when \(100 mL PH _{3}\) decomposed to solid phosphorus and \(H _{2}\) gas.
A spherical ball of radius \(7 cm\) contains \(56 \%\) iron. If the density is \(1.4 g / cm ^{3}\), number of moles of \(Fe\) present approximately is :
A sample of ammonium phosphate contains 3.18 moles of hydrogen atoms. The number of moles of oxygen atoms in the sample is:
Breakfast cereal is advertised to contain 110 mg of sodium per 100 g of the cereal. The percentage of sodium in the cereal is:
<font face="Arial" size="2">Al<sub>2</sub>(SO<sub>4</sub>)<sub>3</sub>.nH<sub>2</sub>O has 8.20% Al by mass. The value of n is</font>
In the reaction \(2 Al ( s )+6 HCl (\) aq. \() \rightarrow 2 Al ^{3+}(a q)+6 Cl ^{-}(a q)+3 H _{2}(g)\)
q_option: 11.2 \(L\) of \(H _{2}( g )\) at STP is produced for every mol of \(HCl\) (aq) consumed.
\(6 L\) of \(HCl\) (aq) is consumed for every \(3 L\) of \(H _{2}( g )\) produced.
33.6 \(L\) of \(H _{2}( g )\) is produced regardless of temperature and pressure for every mol of \(Al\) that reacts.
\(67.2 L\) of \(H _{2}( g )\) at STP is produced for every mole of \(Al\) that reacts.

1.q_string: <font face="Arial" size="2">The percentage by volume of C<sub>3</sub>H<sub>8</sub> in a mixture of C<sub>3</sub>H<sub>8</sub>, CH<sub>4</sub> and CO is 36.5. Calculate the volume of CO<sub>2</sub> produced when 100 ml of the mixture is burnt in excess of O<sub>2</sub>.</font>
One litre of a sample of hard water contain \(4.44 mg CaCl _{2}\) and \(1.9 mg\) of \(MgCl _{2}\), what is the total hardness in terms of \(ppm\) of \(CaCO _{3}\) :
The ionic strength of solution obtained by mixing \(100 mL\) of \(0.1 M Al _{2}\left( SO _{4}\right)_{3}\) and \(100 mL\) of \(0.2 MNa _{2} SO _{4}\) is:
